      • addLink

        public static java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] addLink(java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] chain,
                                                           java.security.PrivateKey chain0PrivateKey,
                                                           SignatureEnum signatureAlgorithm,
                                                           java.math.BigInteger serialNumber,
                                                           java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                           java.util.Date expireDate,
                                                           PKCS10CertificationRequest requestLink)
                                                    throws CertificateAuthorityLtException,
                                                           CertificationRequestLtException,
                                                           CertificateLtException
        Creates a new certificate from the requestLink and adds it to the chain.
        Parameters:
        chain -
        chain0PrivateKey - the private key correspondent to the certificate in index 0 (will be used to sign the new link)
        signatureAlgorithm -
        serialNumber -
        validAfter -
        expireDate -
        requestLink -
        Returns:
        a new array with the new link
        Throws:
        CertificateAuthorityLtException -
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if is not a certificate authority
        +Cause CertificateExpiredException if the certificate has expired
        +Cause CertificateNotYetValidException if the certificate is not yet valid
        CertificationRequestLtException - if some irregular information found in the request
        +Cause InvalidKeyException
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException
        +Cause SignatureException
        CertificateLtException - if some exception occurred at invocation to generate the certificate
        +Cause CertificateEncodingException
        +Cause InvalidKeyException
        +Cause IllegalStateException
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException
        +Cause SignatureException

      • verifyChain

        public static void verifyChain(java.security.cert.Certificate[] chain,
                               java.security.PublicKey pbcKeyTrust)
                        throws CertificateLtException
        Verifies that the root certificate in the chain was signed using the private key that corresponds to the specified public key.
        And all consecutive certificates were signed using the private key that corresponds to the public key in anterior certificate.
        Also verifies that all are of type X.509 and if the current date and time are within the validity period given in all the certificates.
        Parameters:
        chain - with the certificates to verify
        pbcKeyTrust - the PublicKey used to carry out the verification of the root certificate of the chain
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms
        +Cause InvalidKeyException on incorrect key
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException on incorrect provider
        +Cause SignatureException on signature errors
        +Cause CertificateException on encoding errors or it's type is not X.509
        +Cause CertificateExpiredException if the certificate has expired
        +Cause CertificateNotYetValidException if the certificate is not yet valid

      • verifyChain

        public static void verifyChain(java.security.cert.Certificate[] chain,
                               java.security.PublicKey pbcKeyTrust,
                               int secureChainLength)
                        throws CertificateLtException
        Verifies that the root certificate in the chain was signed using the private key that corresponds to the specified public key.
        And all consecutive certificates were signed using the private key that corresponds to the public key in anterior certificate.
        Also verifies that all are of type X.509 and if the current date and time are within the validity period given in all the certificates.

        The chain length will not be asserted if secureChainLength is less then zero.
        Parameters:
        chain - with the certificates to verify
        pbcKeyTrust - the PublicKey used to carry out the verification of the root certificate of the chain
        secureChainLength - the length for the chain be considered secure
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause NoSuchAlgorithmException on unsupported signature algorithms
        +Cause InvalidKeyException on incorrect key
        +Cause NoSuchProviderException on incorrect provider
        +Cause SignatureException on signature errors
        +Cause CertificateException on encoding errors or it's type is not X.509 or the chain doesn't respect the secureChainLength
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if the chain doesn't respect the secureChainLength or if a certificate has a wrong position in the chain
        +Cause CertificateExpiredException if the certificate has expired
        +Cause CertificateNotYetValidException if the certificate is not yet valid
